definition: to boil/to roll/to take a hike/Get lost!
ten-pin bowling/bowling ball/(baseball etc) ground ball

sentences.english: She bowled the ball smoothly down the lane.
sentences.chinese: 她很顺当地把球投入地滚球场的球道。

sentences.english: Lastly a rolling ball technique was used to remedy the crack and gap in the lung boundary.
sentences.chinese: 最后通过滚球法弥合肺边缘的裂缝及缺口。

sentences.english: You are not pitching right, Charlie Brown. How they are hitting the ball on the ground…
sentences.chinese: 你投的不正确，查理布朗，他们打出地滚球。

sentences.english: Petanque is a popular sport in Hong Kong.
sentences.chinese: 滚球是香港很风行的一项运动。

sentences.english: The shaking table test of an SMA strands-composite bearing;
sentences.chinese: 对两质点以滚球隔震模型进行了振动台试验。

sentences.english: Hongkong Electric Lawn Bowls team players.
Ok, let's get the ball rolling.
To throw or roll a ball in bowling.
sentences.chinese: 在保龄球运动中投掷或滚球。

sentences.english: Former President of Penang Amatuer Swimming Association and Penang Lawn Bowl Association.
sentences.chinese: 曾担任槟州业余游泳公会和槟州草地滚球协会主席。

definition: table tennis/table tennis ball (Tw)/billiards/pool/snooker (HK, Singapore, Malaysia)
to catch fish/(fig.) to loaf on the job/to be slack/to take it easy
pole-climbing (as gymnastics or circus act)/climbing pole
to roll over/to turn over (one's body)
to rotate/to twirl/to run around/to encircle/rotation/(coll.) to speak indirectly/to beat about the bush
